column1: full, angling across to off stump. Leans into a checked drive through cover point
still pretty full, but not as full as the previous one, and Stirling leaves it alone
length ball, angling across towards middle and off, defended back to the bowler
full again, angling away from off stump. Gets forward and jabs through point
yikes, that bounced from nowhere. Back of a length, angling across, and it leaps up and beats the outside edge as Stirling shapes to punch through the covers while off his feet

beauty. He's got a few to curl back just a hint, and this one keeps going with the angle to beat Stirling's back-foot defensive. Excellent first over. Replays show it hit a crack and actually nipped away
back of a length, fairly wide of off, and Delaney leaves his first ball in ODI cricket
back of a length, fourth-stump line. No feet from Delany, just pokes at it with a vertical bat and a thick edge ends up running away between the keeper and first slip
length ball, nice teasing line outside off. Left alone
back of a length, close to off stump, gets on his toes and dabs to backward point
short, angling down leg. Delany can't put bat to ball as he looks to pull
back of a length outside off, hops across and steers it neatly to third man to get off the mark in the format
length ball, fifth-stump line, left alone
short of a length and just outside off, defended on the back foot
beaten. Ungainly slash from Delaney, no feet movement at all. This was a full ball pushed across him
length on middle stump, defended on the back foot
oh lovely balance there. Fractionally short on middle stump, gets his weight onto his toes and gets on top of the bounce before pulling along the floor to the square leg boundary
leading edge as he closes the face too early on this flick. Short of a length ball stuck at a leg stump line
length on off, solidly defended on the back foot
length and in at off stump, defended into the leg side with the angle
length on leg stump, leans in and flicks to deep square's left
length at off stump, defended from the crease
length and just outside off, slight late movement away, punched on the rise to mid-off

slower short ball at middle stump, pulled uppishly to deep square's leg. Cottrell does a lovely balancing act running to his left, picking it up on the bounce just inches in from the boundary and then throwing it back in quickly to keep them to a single, although the batsmen had some part in that being only one too
short of a length just outside off, punched to backward point
short and wide outside off, allows that to come on and slaps to third man...who lets it through with a lazy attempt low to his right
length on off, defended on the back foot
beaten. Overpitched and slanted across him, expansive drive attempted
length and just outside off, defended on the front foot
elegant. Short and wide outside off, Stirling quickly gets his weight onto the back foot and punches between point and backward point
full and just outside off, driven to cover on the front foot
full and wide outside off, looks to drive through the covers and misses the ball
good ball, but well kept out. A yorker tailing in at off stump. Does well to keep the front leg out of the way and chop this into the covers
length and just outside off, punched on the rise to cover
length on off stump, pushed into the covers
length outside off, defended to midwicket with the angle
full and just outside off, driven to extra cover
length on off, defended to point
full and very wide outside off, left alone
slower short ball at leg stump, waits on that and swats it uppishly in the square leg region
short at middle stump, swivels nicely and puts this pull away to the backward square leg boundary
short of a length and climbing in the corridor, left alone

straight to short midwicket! That is a sweetly struck pull shot but you don't get away often hitting it at Pollard. To his right with a reverse cup. Short ball just above the waist and he got in great position to play the shot. Just couldn't keep it down
short of a length and climbing in the corridor, sways away to let it go
short of a length just outside off, cut to third man
bouncer up at the right shoulder. A tad too short to make him play. Gets the head out of the way to let that go
length and angled in at middle stump. Punched to mid-on
sweetly timed. Length ball just outside off, leans into it on the front foot and gets this past cover with a gentle drive
short at the body, ducks to let it go
short and in at the hips. Doesn't quite rise so he does well to wait on this, watch it closely, and close the wrists late to steer it to the fine leg boundary with a pull
length on off, defended on the back foot
length on off, defended on the front foot
short of a length in the corridor, defended on the back foot
short of a length on middle, pulled to deep square off the thick inside edge
length and just outside off. Defended solidly into the covers
length outside off, looks to drive on the up, gets it off the inside half of the bat to midwicket

launched over the long leg boundary! Short ball at the chest. It's looked a slow-ish pitch so far and the hook and pull have been good options. Balbirnie hooks from in front of his body and makes no attempt to keep this down
short of a length at leg stump, nudged to fine leg off the inside edge

big appeal for catch behind and it's given! Huge wicket. Chase lobs this out at a length, wide outside off. Balbirnie stretches a long way to defend for the turn but this skids on and kisses the outside edge. It's a good take too from Hope
length ball just outside off, skids on as he lets it go
full on off stump, jabbed out to mid-off with the turn
length ball outside off, shapes to drive but checks to defend late
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
length outside off, solidly defended on the front foot
short of a length on leg, tickled down to fine leg
length on off stump, defended on the back foot
short of a length at leg stump, cramped on the pull, swivels and gets this down to fine leg
full on middle stump, punched to mid-on's right
short outside off, hurriedly gets out of the way to leave
short of a length and in the corridor, left alone
length on middle stump, flicked to midwicket's left
full on off stump, driven to long-off
full outside off, shuffles and drives to sweeper cover
length on off stump, pushed back to the bowler off the front foot
full at the stumps, brings out the reverse sweep but can't beat backward point's dive to the left
length on off stump, defended into the covers
past the outside edge. Length ball slammed in the corridor and slanting across. Stays square and looks to run that to third man
short and across again. Lets that go but tentative about it
short of a length at the mid-riff, looks to pull and cops it on the body
short of a length in the corridor, defended to gully off the outside half
bouncer dug in too short, left alone
full and wide outside off, leans in and drives to sweeper cover
short of a length on leg stump, defended into the leg side off the back foot
full and drifted in at middle, flicked to midwicket
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
length on off, pushed to sweeper cover on the rise
length outside off, leans in and has a poke at it. Thick outside edge to backward point
length outside off, defended on the back foot
full on leg stump, driven to long-on

Porterfield nearly run out! Evin Lewis can't get the direct hit in. Length ball just outside off, defended in front of point with soft hands. Porterfield takes off but has to turn around, there isn't a run there. He gives up. Lewis takes aim and can't hit the stumps at the non-strikers
length at off stump, defended on the back foot

taken low to his left by Shai Hope. Short of a length just outside off. Gets on the back foot and has a hoick at this, probably expecting a bit more bounce. It's not short enough. Skids thigh height and takes the under-edge, and Hope lunges nicely to hold on
back of a length on off stump. Hops back and across to defend, plays with soft hands, and they run a quick single as the ball rolls gently into the leg side
shortish on middle stump, gets on his toes to ride the bounce and defends with soft hands
back of a length on off stump, gets nicely behind it to work it through square leg
full on leg stump, gets his front leg out of the way and clips to long-on
back of a length, close to off stump, not much turn. Stays back and chops it away through point
tossed up outside off, gets forward and reaches out to drive. Shouts of catch it as the ball hangs briefly in the air, but it doesn't carry to extra-cover
tossed up on that wide-ish line again, stretches out and blocks it back to the bowler
nice length outside off, brings O'Brien forward to defend to silly point
full now, outside off, driven to deep point

and there's his third wicket! O'Brien's lack of footwork does him in. Hangs back to a fullish delivery angled into the stumps, and instead shuffles across and looks to work it across the line. He misses, the ball hits his front pad, and it's struck him in line and looks dead-on to hit a good chunk of the stumps too. Doesn't review, just walks off. As he should - struck in front of middle and off, crashing into leg stump, according to ball-tracking.
goes full again to welcome the new batsman, but it slides down the leg side, too fast for Tucker to tuck away to the leg side
shortish now, in the corridor, jumps to ride the bounce and defend into the backward point region

back of a length on off stump. Plays nice and late to dab gently into the point region, and looks at his partner to ask if a single is available. It isn't, as the fielder from backward point hares in super quick
back of a length close to off stump, defended towards backward point
shortish, a bit of width, and he punches it crisply but can't beat Walsh diving right at backward point
length ball angling in towards off stump. Good stride forward to block it back where it came from
looped up nicely outside off, chipped in the air, over the leaping short extra-cover fielder, down to wide long-off
nicely tossed up outside off, driven down to long-off. The ball dipped on the batsman a little, but he controlled the drive well despite not being right up to the pitch of it
flat length ball close to off stump. Punched firmly but extra-cover dives right and stops it to deny any runs

flat, angling down leg, and Porterfield puts it away, getting down low to sweep, and just helping it with the angle to the left of the diving backward square leg fielder. Could have stopped that, Alzarri Joseph
full on leg stump, clipped to midwicket
a bit of flight on off stump, stretches out to block it back to the bowler
short on off stump, pulled away nicely to the left of deep square leg
back of a length on off stump, worked away to deep backward square leg

shortish in the corridor outside off. He's a pretty tall man, Tucker, and he gets on top of the bounce without really having to get on his toes. Taps down on the ball and places it to the right of the lone slip fielder
length ball outside off, pushed into the covers
shortish, doesn't really bounce as much as expected. Ends up caught up between pulling and defending, and the ball hits him on the thigh pad
back of a length on off stump, defended into the covers
flighted ball wide of off. Reaches out to sweep, can't beat midwicket
similar line, but not as full. Stretches out to defend
again that wide-ish line, and Tucker brings out the reverse-sweep. Can't beat backward point, though
back of a length close to off stump, gets deep in his crease and punches into the point region
back of a length close to off stump. Makes a bit of room and cuts firmly, but can't beat backward point
nicely flighted outside off. Looks for the drive to long-off but he has to reach for the ball, and his bottom hand takes over to close the face slightly and send the ball back to the bowler instead
length ball, angling across to middle stump, clipped away to long leg
gone. Short, wide, it was there to cut, but he thrashed too hard at it without necessarily attaining a firm base, and ends up top-edging thickly to the keeper
back of a length on middle and leg, defended into the on side
full now, on that middle-and-leg line again. Looks to flick and inside-edges into his pad
back of a length on leg stump, tucked away to long leg
slower ball, fullish, slanting across the stumps. Defended back to the bowler
tossed up full on middle stump, clipped down to long-on
dangled up wide of off stump. Stretches forward to block into the covers
a touch shorter now, on that wide line. Stays back and chops to deep point
flighted ball outside off, nice use of the wrists to whip it to long-on
full on off stump, driven firmly to the left of the diving bowler, down to long-off. Was in the air as it passed Chase, but travelling very quickly
tossed up a little wider, driven to long-off
shortish, angling across to middle and off. Was looking to get across and tuck it into the leg side, but there's extra bounce, and he misses and gets hit on the midriff
back of a length on middle and leg, tucked into the square leg region
mild lbw shout as Tucker misses the flick. Ball pitched well outside leg, though
back of a length on off stump, punched to cover
back of a length, leg-stumpish, and that's a soft dismissal to send back Singh. Looks to tuck it fine, only manages a thin inside edge to Hope
back of a length on leg stump, and Adair is off the mark with a nicely controlled glance to the fine leg boundary
flat, angling down leg, tickled into the fine leg region
nicely flighted on off stump, gets forward to drive back to the bowler
nice length on off stump, gets forward and opens the face to dab with the turn to backward point
flat on leg stump, gets across to tuck it to the right of short fine leg
flat legbreak pitching on off stump. Goes back and punches firmly, and the bowler moves to his left to stop the single to long-off
nicely bowled. Slower, on middle stump. Looks for the drive to long-on and the ball dips and turns and takes a thick edge and rolls towards backward point instead
shortish on middle and leg, tucked away to deep square leg
short, angling across to off stump. Stays leg-side of the ball, leans back, and slices deliberately between wide slip and backward point
full, angling in from wide of the crease. Gets forward and opens his bat face to steer to backward point
full, angling in towards off stump, defended to cover
back of a length, angling down leg, and Tucker gets a nice bit of wood onto the flick off the hips, and sends it racing to the fine leg boundary
length ball angling into middle and leg, clipped to midwicket
nicely flighted outside off. Doesn't get fully forward to drive, reaches out, and misses thanks to dip and turn
flatter, on off stump, still quite full. Blocked back to the bowler
length ball on off stump, defended with an open face into the backward point region
flighted ball on off stump and Tucker brings out the sweep. This was right in his arc, and he sweeps it hard and flat, all along the ground, into the big gap to the right of midwicket
flat length ball on off stump, gets back to defend to straight midwicket
back of a length outside off, cut away to the right of backward point
back of a length on off stump. Lets it come to him and dabs gently towards backward point
full now, close to off stump, gets forward for a checked drive to mid-off
full outside off, driven to the left of mid-off. Was looking for the gap between cover and mid-off and he couldn't quite find it
length ball on off stump, defended to cover
in the blockhole on middle stump, jams his bat down and digs it out to midwicket
another yorker, on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
nicely bowled. Dangled up outside off, and it dips and turns sharply with some extra bounce. Adair was forward, looking to defend, and he ended up playing a long way inside the line
fuller, punched into the covers
a touch shorter, chopped to deep point
back of a length, spinning from leg to off. Gets deep in his crease and clips to long-on
full on off stump, gets forward to clip to long-on
quickish legbreak on middle and leg. Defended back to the bowler
length ball on middle and leg, shows the full face to punch to mid-on
back of a length on off stump, gets on top of the bounce and defends into the covers

full, on a wide-ish line outside off. Gets forward without his head getting over the ball, and ends up reaching out with his hands to drive. Thick outside edge runs away to the left of the diving backward point fielder
length ball on off stump, defended into the cover point region
short on off stump, pulled to deep square leg
slower ball, fairly full and close to off stump. Driven to mid-off
back of a length, spinning in towards off stump, punched to long-off
flighted ball angling into middle stump, clipped to long-on
tossed up outside off, and Tucker, looking to reverse-sweep, plays too early. Ball bounces a little more than expected and hits his bicep
flatter now, similar line outside off, defended off the front foot
nicely flighted, spinning in from outside off, stretches out to defend back to the bowler
sharp turn from wide outside off, keeps a bit low too. Stays back and blocks it back to the bowler
flat legbreak close to off stump, goes back and punches to deep point
loopy and full on off stump, driven to long-off. Wonder if he was trying the wrong'un
this is the googly. Back of a length, spinning back towards off stump. Goes back and chops it to backward point
tossed up outside off, swept along the ground to deep square leg
flat legbreak spinning from middle to off, goes deep in his crease to defend
angles this down leg, and Tucker can't connect with the attempted paddle-sweep
flat and fullish on middle stump, blocked back to the bowler
tossed up, not too far outside off. Looks to reverse-sweep and can't get it past backward point. Ends up slipping and doing the splits in the process of stretching forward to play the shot
flatter, spins into the stumps, clipped into the square leg region
ooh, risky. Makes room to cut against the turn, and the ball keeps low and misses off stump by inches
fullish on off stump, gets forward to block it back to the bowler
low full-toss outside off, driven to long-off

down the track, and that's a super shot. Gets close to the pitch of this flighted ball drifting away from off stump, and uses a shovelling motion of his bottom hand to generate the power he needs to launch it high over the straight long-off boundary
flat legbreak, goes back and defends as it turns from middle to off
ooh, so close! Dangled up outside off and he doesn't pick the googly at all. Goes for the big cover drive, and it spins back in through the gate, misses off stump, and Hope fumbles to allow a bye
flatter and full on the stumps, driven to long-on
a bit of flight on off stump, stretches out to block it back to the bowler
goes back to a length ball on middle and leg, defends it back to the bowler

extra bounce. Looks for the reverse-sweep again and the ball spins and bounces past his edge. A polite appeal for caught-behind from keeper and bowler. Bat may have scraped the ground. It's sent upstairs to check on the stumping as well, but he never dragged his foot out in the first place
full outside off, driven into the covers
sees him step out and shortens his length. Clipped off the hip through square leg
flat, spins from off to leg, goes back to tuck it to the left of short fine leg
tossed up outside off, driven to mid-off
down the track and he isn't quite to the pitch of this offbreak angled in from wide of the crease. Slogged on the bounce to deep midwicket
excellent length to end an excellent spell. On off stump, and he presses forward and blocks it back to the bowler
shortish on off stump, blocked into the covers. Extra bounce, and he takes the bottom hand off to ensure he keeps it down with soft hands
shot. This short one doesn't get up that high, on off stump, and Adair picks the length early and hammers a pull out to the midwicket boundary
full on middle and leg, clipped to deep square leg
full, angling in towards off stump, opens his bat face to steer to deep point

dropped. Another firmly struck pull from Adair, off a short ball on off stump, but he hits it within range of Pollard at midwicket. He dives right and gets both hands to it, but the ball pops out as his elbows hit the turf
shortish, close to off stump, chopped away through point
length and pushed through flat at middle stump, hurriedly defended on the back foot

completely beaten in flight! Walsh gets this to dip. He's bowled it from about a foot-and-a-half behind the crease. Just short of a good length outside off. Adair might not have stood a chance in any case after stepping out, because he was looking to flick this through the leg side as it spun away from him. Hope's happy day behind the stumps continues, he makes no mistake
googly, length and outside leg. Flicked down to deep backward square
length and wide outside off, reaches out to drive to extra cover
quicker and short outside off, cut straight to backward point
googly tossed up outside off, driven to long-off
short of a length and just outside off. Steered to third man
mean bouncer. Right up the front shoulder. Rapidly up and McBrine fends inside the line. It hits his shoulder and lobs to the keeper's left
short and just outside off. Left alone
slammed in at a length at middle stump. Jumps up and hits the glove as he looks to defend this
short at off stump, gets off the ground to get on top of this. Defended gingerly into the pitch
full on leg stump, deflected down to fine leg off the pad
full and just outside off, nicely to the pitch of this as he drives it past his partner. Mid-on cleans up
length at middle, lobs into the leg side off his front pad as he gets forward to push at it
googly at a length on middle, solidly defended into the off side
length at middle, deep in the crease to tuck this to deep backward square
length on leg stump, flicked into the leg side
short of a length and turning away outside off. Tapped to backward point's right to bring up 150
length on middle stump, pushed into the leg side off the back foot
straight into the box it appears. Or not, he's still on his feet. Short of a length at middle, looks to pull that, but it ends up hitting him in the mid-riff

taken by backward point! That pings off the shoulder of his bat as he has a tentative prod at this length ball outside off. Kicks up off the surface a touch. Tucker rooted to the crease a little and it's an easy take as it floats up in the off side
length at off stump, hurriedly offers the bat and this pings into the off side

lbw give and he reviews it right away. This looks dead in front on line and length, only bat could save him. It's full and dipping at off stump, and he's struck in front of middle...via a big inside edge. He survives.
short of a length and just outside off, 140kph, slams into the bat as he defends off the back foot
just short of midwicket. Short of a length googly turning away from off. Looks to flick that
finds deep midwicket off a full toss! Another attempted googly. Lobbed right up into his swinging arc. Swing he does, but slightly off the inside of the bat. Picks out Keemo Paul with precision
full outside off, looks to drive for line, beaten on the inside edge
full on leg stump, flicked to midwicket's left
googly, full at leg stump. Driven to long-on's left
length at off stump, on the back foot to bunt this
full and down leg side, can't get the flick away
full outside off, looks for the cover drive, ends up jamming it out to mid-off
length outside off, tapped into the covers
hammered! Whew, that was fierce. Slower ball picked up early. Waits on it and uses the considerable width on that to spread his arms and swat it between bowler and mid-off
misfield at mid-off. Length outside off, steps out and slices it in Alzarri's direction and induces a fumble
length and in at the body. Looks to flick, cops that on the pad. Single stolen pitch side on the leg side
full on middle stump, gets deep in the crease and gently tucks this to deep midwicket's right for two
length on off, defended down the pitch
length outside off, gets down and sweeps to deep square
full on off stump, jammed down the pitch
googly at a length, just outside off. Defended on the back foot
past the keeper. Length ball ripping in from a rough outside off. Rankin looks to drill that through the covers and is beaten on the inside edge
full on middle, poked to midwicket's left off the front foot
short and down leg side. Let's that go
wears that on the body. Short and climbing at an off stump line. Fends at that and it's onto him quick
length at middle stump, defended off the inside edge
length at middle stump, watchfully defended
short of a length just outside off, pushed to backward point's left
full and just outside off, pushed into the covers
tossed up wide outside off, drilled out to long-off
short and turning down leg. Left alone
dipping length ball outside off. Beaten on the inside edge again as he looks to drive with front foot nowhere near the ball
length and in at the stumps. Inside edge onto pad as he looks to flick
leading edge as he looks to flick a googly. Harmlessly into the off side
beaten on the sweep. Falls over as he looks to balance
bouncer at leg stump, ducks to let that go
short and in the corridor. Beaten as he looks to nudge to third man
full at the stumps, backs away and pushes into the covers
short of a length just outside off, poked into the off side
nicely done! Full and in at middle stump. Keeps his feet in the leg side but whips firmly with the wrists to get this past the non-striker and beat mid-on to the right
length outside off, defended on the front foot
swatted imperiously! Short and up at the hips. Lines up behind it and beats deep square to his right
length on leg stump, deflected past the keeper off the pad
length on off stump, defended down the pitch off the inside half
yorker length just outside off, looks to jab into the off side, it ends up at midwicket
length and just outside off, defended to point
short in the corridor, drops the wrists and lets it go
taken at long-on. The last wicket's defiance ends. Length ball at middle stump. Clears the front leg and has a swing at this. No real power on that. King takes it well inside the boundary
full on middle stump, jabbed back to the bowler
tossed up full outside off, nice use of the wrists to whip this down to long-on
back of a length, straightens towards off stump. Punched back to the bowler
tossed up slower and fuller, on off stump. Defended with soft hands into the point region
not short by any means, and it's sliding on towards the stumps, but Lewis skips away nimbly to make room and forces it away between backward point and cover point with a lovely flourish
fuller, on off stump, pushed through fairly quick. Defended back to the bowler
length ball, starts wide outside off and swings away further. Left alone, and the umpire signals wide
back of a length, angling into middle and leg. Clipped to long leg
length ball, angling across to off stump. Defended into the covers

lovely shot. Lewis is known for his powerful six-hitting, but he's already played two shots of great finesse today. Full, slanting across to off stump, and he just leans into a drive between cover and mid-off, all timing, the weight transfer doing all the work
full on off stump, driven firmly to mid-off
full again, close to off stump, Lewis plays a checked drive to mid-off
back of a length on off stump, gets nicely behind it and punches to mid-off
length ball spinning in towards off and middle, defended to midwicket
just a touch short on off stump. Makes room and drives firmly to cover point off the back foot
length ball on off stump, punched to long-on
flat length ball sliding in towards off stump. Looks to make room and cut but the lack of turn cramps him, and he chops down late to play it to backward point
full outside off, driven to extra-cover
length ball angling in towards off stump, punched to long-off
length ball slanting away from off stump. Lewis shows the full face for another checked drive to mid-off
back of a length, angling into the fifth-stump channel. Opens his bat face to steer to third man
full, angling in towards off stump, driven to mid-on
length ball angling into off stump, and that's a super shot. Lets it come to him and uses the angle to flick it away to the right of midwicket

even better? This isn't a contest, and we aren't comparing. Not a half-volley at all, but a bit of width, and Hope leans forward to drive on the up through cover point, from where a fielder had just been moved into the leg side
back of a length, angling into middle stump, hops across to tuck it to long leg
flat offbreak, pitching on leg stump and spinning down leg. Looks to flick but the ball spins past his bat and hits his pad
length ball on off stump, makes a bit of room and drives firmly to extra-cover
back of a length, spinning in towards middle stump. Goes deep in his crease to work to square leg
floated up full on middle stump, defended back to the bowler
fired in flatter, slides down leg. Not short enough to pull and the ball sneaks under his bat
a touch short just outside off. Makes some room and chops to cover point
full on middle and off. Looks to get forward and drive to long-off, but extra-cover dives across to half-intercept, and the ball rolls away for a single anyway
length ball on off stump, defended into the covers

back of a length, slanting away from off stump, and some extra bounce causes Lewis a bit of discomfort. Handles it well enough, dropping his wrists down on top of the bounce to keep it down in front of point
back of a length close to off stump, punched into the covers
shortish, a bit more width than the last few balls. Reaches out for a checked uppercut that hangs in the air for a while but safely to the right of backward point

gone, extra bounce does Hope in. Digs this in short, just outside off, and it gets up near his right shoulder. A tough place to pull from, and he only manages a top-edge that balloons high in the air before landing in the hands of Porterfield running to his left from midwicket and diving to take it a couple of feet from the ground
back of a length on off stump, defended into the point region
back of a length close to off stump, gets off his feet to ride the bounce and punch to the right of cover point
back of a length, a tiny bit of width, and Lewis stands tall to punch between backward point and cover point
shortish, down the leg side. Lewis leaves it, raising his bat well over his head to ensure there's nothing left behind for the ball to tickle
back of a length, slanting away into a sixth-stump line. Left alone
back of a length outside off, jabs at it with a slightly angled bat and bottom-edges into the ground
short, and the ball sticks in the pitch and sits up at waist height, on off stump. Waits, holds his shape, and pulls it away to the left of midwicket
length ball angling down leg. Looks to flick, misses, and the ball kisses the edge of his pads and rolls down to the keeper
shortish, angling into the stumps. Looks to flick, is beaten by extra bounce, and the ball hits his thigh pad
length ball on off stump, blocked to mid-off
shortish on off stump. Stays leg-side of the ball, rides the bounce well, and defends into the covers
fullish on middle and off, punched to mid-off
back of a length on off stump, gets across to clip to midwicket. Good over from McCarthy, stuck to a tight line on off stump and earned himself a maiden
back of a length, a bit of width. Goes hard at a back-foot punch, and gets a thickish outside edge that McBrine does well to stop with a dive to his right at point
fullish, angling across into a wide line outside off. Left alone
shot. Short on off stump, doesn't get up too much higher than his waist, and he swivels to put away a short-arm pull to the midwicket boundary
short again, on the hips this time, and Lewis swivels once more to deposit this pull way beyond the long leg boundary

dropped. A fullish ball after those two short ones, slanting away from off stump. Lewis is a little late getting forward, and then he checks his drive and spoons it uppishly towards mid-off, where Kevin O'Brien spills the low chance
salt into wounds. Another short ball, gets up to chest height on leg stump, and Lewis pulls once more, high and far beyond the square leg boundary. That brings up West Indies' 50 as well
full, and King misses his flick, prompting a big lbw appeal from McCarthy. No interest from the umpire, and Ireland don't review either. Was probably sliding down leg
length ball angling into off stump, punched to mid-off
short, angling in over middle stump, and Lewis steps across to give himself the leverage to swat this away to the backward square leg boundary
in the blockhole on off stump, jabbed to mid-on
back of a length, angling into off stump, jabbed to backward point
wow. Full now, angling into off stump, and Lewis takes a step forward and launches this clean and flat over the covers
back of a length, quickish, angling into middle stump. Looks to punch to long-on but can on;ly play ti back to the bowler
quickish again, angling down leg. Gets down on one knee to sweep to long leg with a roll of his wrists
flat, angling in, spinning further in towards leg stump. King is looking to make room, can't find any, and punches back to the bowler
a touch slower now, on middle stump, gets forward and clips to long-on
fullish, angling in towards off stump. Defended with an open face to backward point
flat length ball on off stump, stays back and punches back to the bowler
fullish, angling into off stump, clipped towards midwicket
length ball, pitching on middle and off and slanting away from off stump. Thrusts his front foot confidently forward and leaves
back of a length on leg stump, looks to tuck it away, and manages a leg bye into the backward square leg region
short outside off, steep bounce. Goes for the pull and misses
back of a length, angling into middle stump, steps back and across to work it through square leg
length ball on leg stump, shows the full face and picks up a single with a push to the left of mid-on
short of a length just outside off, punched to extra cover
full and down leg side, cops it on the pad as he looks to sweep
full on off stump, driven with the turn to long-off
full outside off, driven back to the bowler
full on middle stump, flicked down to long-on
deftly done. Full and down leg side, and he pulls out a controlled lap sweep that sums up the evening he's had. Lovely innings, and he has fifty
short outside off, left alone
short of a length in the corridor, tapped into the covers
dropped short at off stump, a glorious front-foot pull but Porterfield does stunningly well sprinting to his left from deep square and putting in a big slide
short of a length outside off, punched through the covers off his toes
length at off stump, defended solidly from the crease
length at off stump, defended solidly on the front foot
gloriious. Tossed up full outside off, languidly puts in a stride and crunches it all along the floor to bisect sweeper cover and extra cover
full on off, blocked on the front foot
length at off stump, defended into the covers
length at middle, clipped into the vacant leg side off the back foot
length and turning in from middle stump. Through the attempted pull early, cops that on the glove
short and just outside off. Backs away and cuts to cover
length on leg stump, flicked into the leg side
good bouncer. Short and slanted in at King who fends and gets out of the way late
short outside off, looks to pull and is beaten
short of a length outside off, hurriedly pushed into the covers
puts this one away. Cramped by the last three short ones, got a bit of room on this and slapped it past point
length at middle stump, tucked into the midwicket region
full on leg stump, firmly swept but straight to short fine
short of a length just outside off, mistimed punch to extra cover
short of a length at middle, punched to long-on off the back foot
length at off stump, blocked on the front foot
short of a length just outside off, punched to sweeper off the back foot
length outside off, defended on the front foot
full on middle stump, driven to mid-on's right
length at leg stump, looks to flick and is rapped on the pad
short of a length outside off, beaten as he looks to chop that to third man
length and just outside off, defended into the covers
inside edge to the fine leg boundary. Short of a length at middle, backs into the leg side and has a hoick at this. Loses his shape but gains four runs
length at leg stump, clipped to midwicket
short of a length just outside off, cut to sweeper cover
length at off stump, pushed to cover off the back foot
steered straight to short fine. Length at leg stump, looks to lap that behind square but it gets big on him and carries easily off the top edge
full on leg stump, defended into the leg side
length at leg stump, flicked to short fine
length ball pushed into the pads. Stands his ground and tickles this fine. Short fine leg is too square to come across
adjusts nicely. This is a slower ball at length, down leg side. Reaches out and caresses it to the fine leg boundary
short of a length on leg stump, dabbed into the square leg region
length at middle stump, defended off the back foot
clears slip. Short and across off stump. Looks for the big pull, gets a top edge
kicks that away from off stump after defending into the pitch. That was headed towards the stumps
length across off stump, left alone
length on off stump, dropped into the off side with soft hands
taken pitch side by Tucker! Length ball turning away from middle stump, gets down for a big slog sweep. It's off the top edge and is pouched some 8 yards from the crease after floating high
full on off stump, driven back to the bowler
length at off stump, defended into the off side
full and flat at middle stump. Hurriedly defended into the off side
length and in at off stump, defended into the off side
length outside off, leans in and opens the face to run this past slip. Comes back for a tight second run
full at the stumps, defended down the pitch
length and slid in at the stumps. Looks to stab into the off side, gets it off the inside half

wow, this is probably the shot of the match. What lovely hands. Full on off stump, a clean swing from underneath that ends with the full face of the bat offered. Effortlessly manages to slam this onto the edge of the roof
full at the stumps again, uses the angle into him to drill it straight and aerially past the bowler
and now square! What a skillful player this guy is. Short of a length and slanted into off stump. Creates room and chops this ruthlessly through point
length outside off, dropped into the covers with soft hands
lobbed full and down leg side. Looks for the sweep, cops it on the pad
length on middle stump, exposes the stumps and looks to punch off the back foot. Thick outside edge to cover
short of a length outside off, mistimed cut to extra cover's right
full at the stumps, defended on the front foot
length at off stump, allows it to come on, opens the face late to get it past slip
chopped to backward point! McBrine has his revenge. Short of a length and angled into him. Some extra bounce as he backs away to cut and that induces a slice from Pooran, and a roar from the bowler
full and just outside off, nice stride into this for a drive through cover
length on leg stump, whipped to deep square
full on off stump, driven to sweeper with the turn
full outside off, driven back to the bowler on the bounce
length in the corridor, punched back to the bowler off the back foot
sweeet. Full and flat at off stump, half a stride and a neat little loft over mid-off. Lands just short of the boundary
full on off stump, nudged into the covers
short of a length and turning away from off stump. Defended off the back foot
length outside off, defended to extra cover
full on off stump, driven to long-off with the turn
length at middle stump, flicked to midwicket's right
back of a length outside off, driven off the back foot to cover
lovely. A bit fuller, and this time Lewis finds the gap, moves his front foot away from the line slightly to be able to free up his arms to drive inside-out, to the right of the cover fielder
flatter, on off stump, defended from the crease into the off side
fuller now on middle and leg, defended back down the pitch
a touch shorter and he rocks back to punch with the turn to deep point
full on off stump, whipped to midwicket
full on off stump, driven into the covers
a bit slower now, reaches out and drives it back to the bowler
flatter, angling into leg stump, and Lewis gets down on his back knee to sweep powerfully along the ground to the left of deep square leg
back of a length outside off, and Lewis waits and waits before Ranatunga-ing it just as it's about to reach the keeper's gloves, deftly guiding it into the third man region
flatter and fuller on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
tossed up outside off, gets forward and dabs with an open face towards backward point
full on off stump, driven to sweeper cover
nice length, spinning in towards off stump, defended back to the bowler
and again, dip and turn from just outside off. Gets forward to defend and the ball rolls into the leg side off the inner half of the bat
fuller now, whipped away to deep square leg with a roll of the wrists
back of a length on middle stump, makes some room and punches to long-off
looped up outside off and Chase gets forward and uses his reach to drive to the right of sweeper cover
flat, angling into the pads, uses his wrists for a short-arm whip to deep backward square leg
tossed up on off stump, and Roston Chase unfurls the inner VVS Laxman, uses his wrists to whip this offbreak into the gap between midwicket and mid-on
nicely flighted, gets a bit of late drift away towards off stump. Was looking to flick towards midwicket, ended up playing it back to the bowler as a result
flatter, spins in towards leg stump, clipped to deep square leg
tossed up on leg stump, swept firmly to deep backward square leg
floated across towards off stump. Gets forward and dabs with an open face to backward point

a rare mishit from Lewis. Length ball slanting across to off stump. Wanted to hit over mid-off, but the length and the angle caused him to slice it high over point instead. Doesn't carry all the way to the sweeper, though
length ball on middle and leg, defended towards mid-on
back of a length on off stump, punched to sweeper cover
bouncer over off stump, Chase manages to get his 6'5' body to crouch just about adequately enough to get under it
back of a length close to off stump, lets it come on and steers to third man
short slower ball angling away from off stump. Pulled along the ground to the right of deep square leg
back of a length on off stump, punched to extra-cover
full on middle and off, driven to mid-off
short outside off, stops on Lewis a bit. Wants to cut this through point, but he ends up chopping into the covers instead
back of a length outside off, punched to point
back of a length, not far outside off. Waits a little longer this time and chops to third man
back of a length outside off, dabbed down to third man
fullish, angling into leg stump, clipped to deep square leg
shortish, gets up near Lewis' stomach, swivels to pull along the ground to long leg
full, angling down leg, can't connect with the flick. Was probably looking for the yorker
bouncer over off stump, sways away and leaves it alone
full, a bit of width, and Chase leans into a flowing drive, with high left elbow, to beat cover diving to his right
shortish in the corridor, jumps to ride the bounce and dabs to third man
back of a length, angling away from off stump, opens his bat face to steer towards backward point
bouncer over off stump, sways his upper body away from the line to ignore it
back of a length close to off stump, defended into the point region
back of a length on off stump, gets back and across to defend into the on side
back of a length, angling in towards off and middle, defended to midwicket

whoa, that came out of nowhere. This pitch has always had this in it. Digs it in short, and gets it to bounce brutally in the fourth-stump channel. Chase tries to sway away, tries to pull his hands out of the way, but can't prevent the ball kissing his gloves on the way through to the keeper
shuffles down the pitch to a length ball outside off, and defends into the point region

full, slanting away from off stump. Lewis drives with an open face, and he threads it past backward point, but has he hit it too well? Will third man, sprinting to his left, be able to stop the boundary? He does, and Lewis is on strike with the possibility of a century still alive

... IT NEARLY DOES! NEARLY! But it doesn't. Fullish, slanting away from off stump, and Lewis launches a big drive over extra-cover, only for the ball to land inches... INCHES... in front of the boundary. Lewis finishes unbeaten on 99
